comments:
I'm running Eclipse 3.1M5a on MacOS X and Windows XP.  This problem only occurs
on MacOS X (I'm running 10.3.8).  Here's the java description on my MacOS X box:
java version "1.4.2_05"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2_05-141.3)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2-38, mixed mode)

To reproduce:

1)  Add a file to a project under CVS control of an unknown file type.  In my
test, I added a file called "test.junk"
2)  Team->Commit the file
3)  The "Add Resources/Unknown new files detected" dialog appears.
4)  Click on the "Binary" text in the Content column in the table.  Switch it to
ASCII.  (You can also select the "Remember Decision" text too)
5)  Click anywhere in the white space in the window, You'll get an "Error
Occurred" dialog, and the following NPE in the .log file.

If you're very careful to "not" click anywhere but on the buttons and on the
Binary/ASCII text, you can get the commit to complete. But, if you get this
error, and click "OK" to the error dialog, then "Finish" to the Commit Files
dialog, then eclipse just hangs up.  I had to "Force Quit" the application.
